intro: Thlaspi rivale, commonly known as water pennycress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and is often found in moist environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. The plant has basal leaves that are lobed and alternate leaves along the stem, which are typically smaller and more elliptical. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in clusters, typical of the mustard family. Thlaspi rivale is known for its ability to thrive in wet conditions and is sometimes used in phytoremediation due to its tolerance of heavy metals.
